TopicTitle: Kerbal Space Program Earns Honorable Mention from the Independent Games Festival

Articles.Content:
<p><img src="https://31.media.tumblr.com/947c477f60b10a554f2f4f76a53224c7/tumblr_inline_mz1sl3Sbf61rr2wit.jpg"/></p>

<p><strong><em>Kerbal Space Program</em></strong> was named as an honorable mention for the <strong>Seumas McNally Grand Prize</strong> at the <strong><a href="http://bit.ly/1htAaPp" target="_blank">2014 Independent Games Festival</a></strong>. While ultimately not a finalist, it’s still a huge honor for an unfinished title, such as ours, to be acknowledged among some of the biggest and most innovative indie games out there - especially for the top prize.<br/><br/> The <strong>Independent Games Festival</strong> was formed in 1998 to encourage innovation and highlight the best that independent gaming has to offer. To view the full list of awards and nominees, go <strong><a href="http://bit.ly/1htAaPp" target="_blank">HERE</a></strong>.</p>

Congratulations ! KSP is, increasingly faster, gathering public attention and that's great.

I bet you'll be finalist when the finished version will be done!

PS: I'm not sure "increasingly" is a word...

But - hey - you catch my drift
